review: I do not have cable. I mostly watch content on youtube and netflix. Though streaming players like Roku did fulfill my need of allowing to stream from these websites onto the TV, I was not a big fan of the interface/remote that made it hard to search for stuff (or even type for that matter). The other solution was to connect a HDMI cable to my laptop/tablet which was ugly. Chromecast provides a neat solution for this especially for netflix/youtube for which it seems to be heavily optimized (the streaming starts off in the device and I have not had any issues like lag so far). But streaming from other websites using the chomecast  plugin is not smooth and I frequently see a lag (I think this is still an experimental feature). Also, streaming videos stored on the system is almost unusable. But I think for the price, I get awesome value from Netflix/youtube streaming.
author: Mamamya

review: I have Roku so I didn't think that I'd need it.  However, since it was so affordable, I got it anyway and boy am I glad that I did!  We cut our cable cord so we just used my Chromebook via page cast to watch the Super Bowl on our TV.  Set up was very easy and I did not have any problem casting YouTube or other webpages onto my TV.  Casting was super easy from my iPhone 5 as well.  You can't go wrong with this nifty gadget.
author: Helen S. Lam

review: Works great as advertised! I use it all the time now at home and for the price it's definitely worth it!!

review: If you have any concern at all about your privacy, you should stay away from it. It collects your WiFi information, including the password, forces you to use Chrome browser. Technically it is an OK unit, not better of worse than the alternatives. While it may differ for person to person, for me privacy is very important so this unit is a NO NO. I returned it shortly after I received it.
